function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Change in types of physical activities due to various factors such as lack of time, space, and increase in family roles"},{"name":"Increased awareness of the importance of exercise and immunity during the pandemic"},{"name":"Reduced physical activity due to covid-related restrictions"},{"name":"Economic and financial distress as a barrier to physical exercise"},{"name":"Inequality in physical exercise among college students"},{"name":"Lack of physical exercise during the covid-19 lockdown causing physical health problems and susceptibility to severe form of covid-19"},{"name":"Lack of facilities and time constraints due to quarantine, self-isolation, and lockdown hindering physical activities"},{"name":"Inhibited social interaction due to social distancing may exacerbate psychological distress."},{"name":"Restricted collective activities during the pandemic have triggered mental health problems."},{"name":"Lack of physical activity and group physical activity due to social distancing measures."},{"name":"Reduced physical activity during covid-19 may lead to higher levels of loneliness, sadness, and anxiety."},{"name":"Gender differences in exercise behavior during the pandemic."},{"name":"Reduction in exercise behavior for male individuals during the pandemic."},{"name":"Passive exercise behavior in young people"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on mental health and exercise behaviors"},{"name":"Dependence on remote or face-to-face supervision for exercise"},{"name":"Lack of social support may lead to decreased physical activity, impacting overall health and well-being."},{"name":"Differences in living environments impact physical activity levels, potentially leading to disparities in health outcomes."},{"name":"Lack of robust research and data collection may limit the understanding of the role of physical activity in maintaining mental health during pandemics."},{"name":"Lack of physical activity due to pandemic restrictions leading to physical and mental health issues"},{"name":"Limited awareness of the importance of physical activity during a pandemic"},{"name":"Vulnerability of specific demographic groups to negative effects of restriction measures"},{"name":"Limited access to internet prevents adoption of online supervised exercise in low- and middle-income countries."},{"name":"Different types of exercise may have varying stress-buffering effects on mental health, affecting different groups of people under different contexts."},{"name":"Limited access to supervised exercise and mentoring may hinder motivation for physical activity, particularly in times of stress."},{"name":"Lack of strategies for encouraging physical activity during health crises like covid-19"},{"name":"Limited evidence on the effectiveness of recommended physical activity strategies for the general public"},{"name":"Incomplete data analysis and research on the impact of covid-19 on physical activities and mental health"},{"name":"Highly communicable disease covid-19"},{"name":"Poor management of key risk factors due to covid-19 response measures"},{"name":"Negative impact on the nutritional status of women and children"},{"name":"Potential effect on maternal nutrition, micronutrient deficiencies, intrauterine growth, and downstream impacts on maternal and child health programs."},{"name":"Collapse or reduced efficiency of sectors critical to reducing childhood undernutrition due to the widespread impact of covid-19 mitigation strategies"},{"name":"Limited access to health care for remote and hard-to-reach populations"},{"name":"Lack of focus on health and nutrition priorities during covid-19
